intro: Dryandra montana, commonly known as the mountain dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Dryandra montana is often found in open woodlands and is a characteristic component of the region's flora.
